Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Class VirtualView

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.VirtualView
public class VirtualView
extends java.lang.Object
Handles the serialization of messages from server to client and the deserialization of messages from client to server. Each Client is associated to a specific VirtualView.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean alive
    Set to false when the client is disconnected.
    private java.lang.String id
    The nickname chosen by the user.
    private java.io.ObjectInputStream input
    InputStream for inputs from the client.
    private java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue<ToServerMessage> messageQueue
    Queue for all incoming messages from the client.
    private java.io.ObjectOutputStream output
    OutputStream for outputs to the client.
    private java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue<ToServerMessage> pingQueue
    Queue for all incoming ping responses from the client.
    private PlayerController playerController
    The controller associated with the client.
    private java.net.Socket socket
    Socket for client communications.

      Socket for client communications.

      Queue for all incoming messages from the client.

      private final java.util.concurrent.SynchronousQueue<ToServerMessage> pingQueue
      Queue for all incoming ping responses from the client.

      InputStream for inputs from the client.

      OutputStream for outputs to the client.

      The nickname chosen by the user.

      The controller associated with the client.

  • Constructor Details

    • VirtualView

      public VirtualView​(java.net.Socket socket, java.io.ObjectInputStream input, java.io.ObjectOutputStream output)
      VirtualView constructor. This constructor:
      • sets the attributes to the values received as arguments or their default values;
      • creates a messageQueue where the messages from the associated client to the server will be placed;
      • creates a pingQueue;
      • creates a Thread to continuously listen to the associated client, deserializing his messages;
      Parameters:
      socket - the socket associated with the client
      input - the ObjectInputStream associated with the socket
      output - the ObjectOutputStream associated with the socket

  • Method Details

    • resetStreams

      public void resetStreams() throws java.io.IOException
      Allows resetting the ObjectInputStream and ObjectOutputStream associated to the communication on the client socket.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • getSocket

      public java.net.Socket getSocket()
      Returns:
      the socket, ie the communication channel between server and the client associated with this VirtualView

    • getId

      public java.lang.String getId()
      Returns:
      the ID of the Player associated with this VirtualView

    • setId

      public void setId​(java.lang.String id)
      Sets the id attribute to the String received as an argument (ie the ID of the Player associated with this VirtualView).
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the Player

    • getPlayerController

      public PlayerController getPlayerController()
      Returns:
      the PlayerController associated with this VirtualView

    • setPlayerController

      public void setPlayerController​(PlayerController playerController)
      Sets the playerController attribute to the PlayerController Object received as an argument.
      Parameters:
      playerController - the PlayerController of the Player associated with this VirtualView

    • isInGame

      public boolean isInGame()
      Returns:
      true is the Player associated with this VirtualView is still in the Game, false otherwise

    • clientListener

      public void clientListener()
      For all the time the VirtualView is active, this method allows listening to the associated client and deserializing the messages wrote by the client on the communication channel. If the message is a Pong, offers it on the pingQueue; if the message is a message from the client to the server, offers it on the messageQueue.

    • takeInput

      public ToServerMessage takeInput() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Allows taking from the messageQueue a message previously sent by the client to the server.
      Returns:
      the message taken from the messageQueue
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • checkAlive

      public void checkAlive() throws java.io.IOException
      Allows the server to check whether a client is still active or not. Makes an attempt to send a Ping and to receive a Pong as a reply; if it fails, tries again. If it fails again, throws an IOException described by a "time out" message.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when the second attempt to receive a Pong fails

    • chooseCards

      public java.util.ArrayList<Card> chooseCards​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> possibleCards, int num, java.util.ArrayList<Card> pickedCards) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him to choose some Cards among those available. Creates a new Message (ChooseCards Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue, selects the Cards that the client chose and returns them in an ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      possibleCards - an ArrayList containing all the available Cards
      num - the number of Cards to pick
      pickedCards - an ArrayList containing all the already picked Cards
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the chosen Cards
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseGameName

      public java.lang.String chooseGameName​(boolean taken) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking the name for the Game he is creating. Creates a new Message (ChooseGameName Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      taken - true if the previously chosen Game name is already taken, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the Game name chosen by the client
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseGameRoom

      public java.lang.String chooseGameRoom​(java.util.ArrayList<Game> gameRooms) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him to choose which Game room to join to. Creates a new Message (ChooseGameRoom Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      gameRooms - the Game rooms actually available to play
      Returns:
      the Game room chosen by the client
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseNickname

      public java.lang.String chooseNickname​(boolean taken) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking his nickname. Creates a new Message (ChooseNickname Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      taken - true if the previously chosen nickname is already taken, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the nickname chosen by the client
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • choosePlayersNumber

      public int choosePlayersNumber() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking the number of players for the Game. Creates a new Message (ChoosePlayersNumber Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Returns:
      the number of players chosen by the client for the Game
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseStartPosition

      public Cell chooseStartPosition​(java.util.ArrayList<Cell> possiblePositions, int num) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him the starting position for his Worker. Creates a new Message (ChoosePosition Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      possiblePositions - an ArrayList containing all the positions the client can choose among
      num - the number of the Worker the client has to choose the position of
      Returns:
      the chosen position
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseWorker

      public Worker chooseWorker​(java.util.ArrayList<Worker> workers) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him the Worker he wants to use during the current turn. Creates a new Message (ChooseWorker Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      workers - an ArrayList containing the available workers
      Returns:
      the chosen Worker
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseMovePosition

      public Cell chooseMovePosition​(java.util.ArrayList<Cell> possibleMoves) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him the position he wants to move his Worker to during the current turn. Creates a new Message (ChoosePosition Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      possibleMoves - an ArrayList containing all the positions the client can choose among
      Returns:
      the chosen position
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseBuildPosition

      public Cell chooseBuildPosition​(java.util.ArrayList<Cell> possibleBuilds) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him the position he wants his Worker to build in during the current turn. Creates a new Message (ChoosePosition Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      possibleBuilds - an ArrayList containing all the positions the client can choose among
      Returns:

      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseStartingPlayer

      public int chooseStartingPlayer​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him which player should start playing. Creates a new Message (ChooseStartingPlayer Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      players - an ArrayList containing all the players to choose among
      Returns:
      the number associated to the chosen player
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseStartJoin

      public boolean chooseStartJoin() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him to choose between starting a new Game or joining an existing one. Creates a new Message (ChooseStartJoin Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Returns:
      true if the client chose to start a new Game, false if the client chose to join an existing one
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • chooseYesNo

      public boolean chooseYesNo​(java.lang.String query) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, asking him to answer to a "yes or no" question. Creates a new Message (ChooseYesNo Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. Takes the client's answer from the messageQueue and returns it.
      Parameters:
      query - the question the client should answer to
      Returns:
      true if the client answered "yes", false if he answered "no"
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • displayBuild

      public void displayBuild​(CellView buildPosition, Card godPower) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him of a new build. Creates a new Message (DisplayBuild Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      buildPosition - the position of the new building
      godPower - the Card associated to the God Power that eventually allowed this build
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • displayGameInfo

      public void displayGameInfo​(Game game, java.lang.String desc) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him an information. Creates a new Message (DisplayGameInfo Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      game - the current situation of the Game
      desc - the information
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage​(java.lang.String message) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him an information. Creates a new Message (DisplayMessage Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      message - the String describing the message to sent
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • displayMove

      public void displayMove​(java.util.HashMap<CellView,​CellView> moves, Card godPower) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him of a new move. Creates a new Message (DisplayMove Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client. The HashMap received as an argument will contain: - a pair of positions if only one Worker moved; - two pairs of positions if two Workers moved (in this case the godPower parameter mustn't be null: this kind of double move is only allowed thanks to a God Power).
      Parameters:
      moves - an HashMap containing the starting position and the final position of each Worker who moved.
      godPower - the Card associated to the God Power that eventually allowed this move
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • displayPlaceWorker

      public void displayPlaceWorker​(Cell workerPosition) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him the placing of a Worker. Creates a new Message (DisplayPlaceWorker Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      workerPosition - the position of the Worker
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • notifyGameStarting

      public void notifyGameStarting() throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.InterruptedException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him the Game is starting. Creates a new Message (NotifyGameStarting Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the thread handling the communication is waiting and it is interrupted before or during its activity

    • notifyLoss

      public void notifyLoss​(java.lang.String reason, Player winner) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him his loss. Creates a new Message (NotifyLoss Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason he lost, can be:
      • "outOfWorkers" if the Player lost because he ran out of Workers;
      • "outOfMoves" if the Player lost because he ran out of moves;
      • "outOfBuilds" if the Player lost because he ran out of builds;
      • "godConditionAchieved" if the Player lost because another Worker achieved his God's win condition;
      • "winConditionAchieved" if the Player lost because another Worker achieved the normal win condition.
      winner - null if the Player lost by his own, not null if the Player lost because another Player won
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • notifyWin

      public void notifyWin​(java.lang.String reason) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him his victory. Creates a new Message (NotifyWin Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason of his victory, can be
      • "godConditionAchieved" if the Player won by achieving his God's specific win condition;
      • "winConditionAchieved" if the Player won by achieving the normal win condition;
      • "outOfWorkers" if the Player won because the only Player left ran out of Workers;
      • "outOfMoves", if the Player won because the only Player left ran out of moves;
      • "outOfBuilds", if the Player won because the only Player left he ran out of builds.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • notifyDisconnection

      public void notifyDisconnection​(Player player) throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him that a Player disconnected. Creates a new Message (NotifyDisconnection Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Parameters:
      player - the client who disconnected
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • notifyGameOver

      public void notifyGameOver() throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him the Game is over. Creates a new Message (NotifyGameOver Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs

    • serverClosed

      public void serverClosed() throws java.io.IOException
      Sends a message to the client, in order to notify him that the server is closing. Creates a new Message (NotifyGameOver Message) and writes it on the ObjectOutputStream so that it can be serialized and sent to the client.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when an exception related to ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream occurs
